Reviews.Title: “Interesting room set up”
Reviews.Author: brian61982
Reviews.Content: Huge bedroom and living room but not much lighting. Excellent bathroom setting with lots of room and light. Very institutional appearance. Pipes showing under sink in living room area. Clean and ok for one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great for inexpensive get a way”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: Great value if you're looking for a good place to stay when you aren't out on the town! I was in town for 4 nights on business and 3 more for pleasure. It was not fancy, but either was the price. Save your money for touring and stay here! Quite a small balcony, but it was overlooking the ocean--fantastic! The pool closed really early, like 5 pm. So we didn't get to use it, but it looked pretty! The beach that is right across the highway was messy-- trash and tree debris washed up on the beach made it not a good place to walk. And there's no swimming there. So, that's kind of a bummer. So if you're wanting a "beach" hotel, this isn't it, although it is right across the highway from the beach. Bedding is nice; white down comfortors and bed itself were very comfy. The staff was helpful. I don't expect a full concierge service of course! But everyone from front desk to housekeeping to breakfast people were helpful. There was a computer and printer easily available. Breakfast was nice. Eggs and meat, waffles, etc. Always refilled, fresh, and well stocked. A bonus! A few nights there were loud and rowdy guests, and some road noise b/c it is right on the highway. But otherwise it is quiet. It is in a mostly residential neighborhood; it really feels like you're in Puerto Rico (rather than in some resort area that could be anywhere in the world). Get a feel for the community and stay here, not in the super-touristy spots. The only thing that was a 'negative' is that our shower curtain was a few inches shorter than the rim on the tub, so water hits the shower curtain and goes outside the tub, flooding the bathroom floor. A couple days we didn't get a bath mat, so it was a bit of a mess. A longer shower curtain would take care of the issue. Overall, a good experience and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “TWO NIGHT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Treadman46
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, quiet locations, nice pool. Front desk clerks were very friendly. Continental breakfast had several choices. In room coffee makers. On site restaurant but it was a little pricey. Restaurant across the street is the only other one nearby. We were about 3 miles from a good beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Levittown”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: Staff(manager, front desk) will do the very best to make you feel comfortable. Need a vehicle since it takes about 20-25 mins. from the SJ Airport. Taxi will cost you $50-60/one way. Easy access to any place from this location. Basic needs are meet in this hotel-nice clean bed and rooms look clean. Pictures on the internet are deceiving-rooms are very small. No hot water at the time that I stayed, cable TV was not available, but wi-fi was functional. Parking is limited but back-up parking is available within one minute-no charge for parking. Breakfast was great, but stay away from the milk(locally produced, taste?, possible stomach issues). rest of the breakfast is good. Lots of noise in the morning since it is next to a major intersection. Additional charges on final bill(normal in any hotel in PR. Some hotels call it resort fee). Restaurant on the 6th floor. One mexican and seafood restaurant right across the street. I did not eat there but was told that all restaurants were good. If you want to safe money and planning to be out most of the day and only go to the hotel to sleep and have a quick breakfast in the morning, then this is the place to stay. If you want to have the luxuries that you expect from the US hotel chains then stay close to the airport, within walking distance to the beach(plenty of hotels but very pricey). If you rent a car stop by the Pueblo Grocery Store right after you exit the airport(ask for directions-it is easy and I strongly recommend). Get some basics-juices, sodas, snacks. Enjoy your stay in "la Isla del Encanto"-Enchanted Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st time in Puerto Rico........”
Reviews.Author: twilliams31093
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to PR, not knowing where the best place to get a hotel in i ultimately picked the Comfort inn in Levittown, which wasnt the worst pick but also not the best im sure, but overall a nice stay, at first we were not too thrilled about the room they stuck us in, I prerequested and upgraded to a great ocean view room, I double confirmed by calling the hotel prior to our arrival so i was assured we would have no issue but although i was given a room on the ocean side the only view we had was the coconut/palm trees outside my window, so i immediately called downstairs to see what happened and was told there was no special request noted and that because they over booked that coming weekend there was nothing she could do (per marlena) i came by the next day and she avoided looking at me so to prevent from runing my whole day i went on my way, that evening i asked again what can be done before i went to corporate and the very next morning the wonderful manager Marsella was awsome came in finally heard the situation for the first time and she immediately upgraded me from the 2nd floor to the 4th with an AWSOME view, she also helped us as we were dining inthe rooftop restaurant.....she was greeat....gave us tips on were to go do some shopping so if you go make sure if you have any issues ask for her! The stay was nice, the a/c was a lil loud as well as passing traffic, water pressure is def. not like back home.......lol but it was on a not so busy side of town, the two restaurants across the street were great! Compamar restaurat sereved awsome food and great priced drinks with a typical islandish atmostphere and for something quick or just somewhere to sit an enjoy the surroundings go visit taco pancho where they will get you nicely lit for the low low, they do not cheat you on the Don Q rum!!! mixed drinks for $3.00??? Really? A must do......otherwise PR was absolutely beautiful......the people the beaches just everything......we will definately be back thanks Comfort INN and Ms. Marsela keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value! Large rooms with great views”
Reviews.Author: authored
Reviews.Content: We always choose to stay here for the first night after flying in to San Juan, but you must rent a car to get here, as it is located west of San Juan, about 15 miles. The staff is super friendly and the rooms are superb. The breakfast is the usual Comfort Inn fare, ok, but not great. The view from the rooms is superb, especially at night when you can see the occasional cruise ship departing San Juan. There are good local restaurants nearby and also one on the top floor of the hotel. The beach across the street is heavily polluted and not suitable for anything. Overall, a great place to stay the first night, particularly if you are headed to the west coast via car.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: darren m
Reviews.Content: Extremely Friendly and accomodating staff. I went to puerto Rico for a cruise and decided to arrive a few days earlier to view the authentic (non)-touristy areas for a few days before the ship sailed. The airlines promptly lost my luggage for almost a full 24 hours and the staff was extremely helpful in making sure that when it did arrive that it was waiting in our room for us. Because I was awaiting my swimsuit they even opened the pool later that night just for us so we could swim when our luggage arrived. Nice Room with a view of The pool. Nice pool with a fountain and waterfall. There is a very good restaurant upstairs ( I recommend the Conch Cocktail and the crab(jueyes) Mofongo). Lots of local cuisine within walking distance. The cleaning Lady was very pleasant and swapped out our broken tv remote. The hotel is about a 50 dollar cab ride from SJU airport it is about a 40 minute ride. It is however 10 minutes from the Bacardi Rum Factory which I highly recommend visiting. There is a nice ocean view across the street. Overall the facilities are good. There is a decent breakfast served in the morning (waffle maker) Juices, muffins, scrambled eggs, sausage, fruits, cereal, toast etc. I would rate it a solid 3 out of 5 for overall appearance. It's not a 5 star hotel but the service is pretty close. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Clean & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: stevetraveling2pr
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Puerto Rico probably 20 to 25 times in the last 3 years and this is by far the cleanest non 5 star hotel I have found in Puerto Rico. This has been my third trip to the Comfort Inn in Levittown and every stay has been very pleasant. If you are looking to party all night, then you should stay in the heart of San Juan or Old San Juan, but if you would like a little get away where things slow down just a bit, then this is well worth looking into. The rates are very reasonable. The rooms and bathrooms are not very big, but I donâ€™t go to Puerto Rico to camp out in my room. The beds are very comfortable and the AC could freeze you out if that is how you like it. The view of the sea is great; there are no buildings between the hotel and the ocean. Isla de Cabras (which is a park) is right down the road. It has good fishing and is directly across the bay from Old San Juan. There is a very nice restaurant on the top floor of the hotel and a local pub and grill right across the street. The two biggest items that keep me coming back is the very friendly and helpful staff and how it is always so clean. In the morning you will see several workers making it spotless and tending to all the plants. This one is definantly a great value and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and mouldy”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Pez
Reviews.Content: The room was functional but smelt mouldy, which hit you as soon as you walked in, even the bedspread had mould on it. The room was pretty shabby and the air conditioning unit was so noisy it stopped us sleeping. The shower was the worst thing as there was NO pressure at all and the water just trickled out, and we even had to use plastic cups to help with the whole washing process! The restaurant on the top floor was surprisingly good though, and we enjoyed the one meal we had up there, finding the service good and the food tasty. Not a hotel I would return to,

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Good Experience.”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousExpectation
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to stay. the price was good. It is a much better experience than the downtown San Juan location. The room was clean. The staff is very nice and helpful. The hotel has a great ocean view (upper floors). The restaurant good food and service (although a little pricey). The parking is FREE (unlike the downtown location). Although the inside hotel lot is limited, there is additional FREE parking on a hotel lot adjacent to the property. It's location is about 8-10 miles away from downtown and airport etc. but if you have a rental car it is a perfect location. I'm glad I didn't let the bad reviews turn me away. This is an island hotel and it is not in a newer building but it is an overall good experience. I cannot say the same about the downtown location. I will stay here again if I'm in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “OVER PRICED, DIRTY AND NOISY...”
Reviews.Author: tdvmaat
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping needs a major overhaul! We used two different rooms and the walls were all marked up with yucky drips and stains. The bathroom wall had dirt, dust and spider webs with little gnats stuck on the wall (the perfect food for the lizard living in the room). The floor had crusted on dirt in the corners and there was dusty dirt all around the room's baseboards. No washcloths, shampoo or conditioner because the â€˜shipment wasnâ€™t in yetâ€™. The shower had a sharp, broken, rusty drain cover which we asked the front desk to replace and they never did. This is a very noisy place to stay because of all the street traffic as well as party noise from other rooms, and the 6th floor events. Parking is not very good. There's an extremely small, tight fitting lot for maybe 10 cars. The 6th floor restaurant has nice views but is also overpriced. SAVING GRACES? -Beds were very comfortable -Breakfast room served a decent spread -Across the street is a rustic restaurant (with very tasty local foods) named "Campomar" -The little lizard living in the room provided hours of entertainment

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach view”
Reviews.Author: Carmen C
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in. It had the most beautiful view of the beach. The people who work there were very nice. We did have a slight problem but it was taken care of right away!! Nice pool with a waterfall too. Can't wait to stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for one night - free on points - definitely much better than the one in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: PaCricket
Reviews.Content: Not fancy but definitely nicer than the Comfort hotel in San Juan,especially as we were traveling west the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rod M
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Puerto Rico, we had The Best Vacation Ever! We stayed at the Levittown Comfort Inn & Suites, so far the best hotel in the area. This Hotel is located close to the beach, but you will say almost all of them are near. This one is not only in front of the beach but near every were! Close to San Juan if we wanted to go to the Old city, close to Arecibo, or the north coast why because the Highway is near the Hotel and we barely had to be stock in traffic (Tapon in Puerto Rico a scary word). Also close to Carolina, Ponce, Fajardo you named. We did our schedule and we traveled the whole Island of the Beautiful Puerto Rico... The next vacation ummm, you know where we going and where we are staying. The service was wonderful and the pool was the hang out for our kids after dusk. Comfort inn & Suites of Levittown Puerto Rico keep up the good work!!!!!! Please. See you next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Low Price, Low Quality”
Reviews.Author: mvg1269
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget, you may want to look into staying at the CIS. Otherwise, you may be better off staying somewhere else. Even though the room was well-appointed, it faced on to the pool area which became quite crowded very early the next morning. The hotel was booked for the holidays (Easter) and spring breakers had the run of the place. Overall, it wasn't a horrible hotel, just not comfortable or in an area that you'd feel safe walking through at night. The room I was given was clearly meant for someone with a disability since the toilet and the shower were essentially about 6 inches from one another and there was a white stool to accommodate someone who might have had a difficult time bathing. It was quite a depressing experience. I was so eager to leave the hotel that I yanked open the door and the security "chain" flew right off!! Forget breakfast--it's continental so the offerings were slim to say the least, and the eatery was noisy and crowded with tourists-particularly a jarring experience-especially if you like a subdued dining experience. Although the gracious front desk people offered us a room on a higher floor, we decided to cut our stay short and moved to Dorado.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok for cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wetwklley99
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located across from the water but the beach is full of trash. The rooms are big but needs renovation bad. I got the room free using points so I can not complain to bad. If I was paying for it I would have moved.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convinient for a small budget”
Reviews.Author: ruthcaliz
Reviews.Content: It is a hotel with all the things you need to stay for 1 or 2 nights. No luxury, just basics. It has a small pool, nice for children. The complimentary breakfast is a must. The rooms are clean and the wifi is perfect at the room and public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Prefer being in San Juan...”
Reviews.Author: benharper64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst place ever!!. I went after thanksgiving with my family and the people treat you kinda nice but they need to learn english since they dont know much. The housekeepers do a sloppy job on my room. I went to the restaurant and the service was not that good, i waited for an hour for my meal. Front desk always was busy and felt unimportant. Never coming back! I dont recommend this hotel for anybody!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel everrrr”
Reviews.Author: sdj0903
Reviews.Content: I cant wait for the next year..i travel every year to PR and this was my 1st time in this hotel. The staff are so friendly the services etc i dont have any complain.....see ya next year

Reviews.Title: “West of San Juan out of Harms Way !!”
Reviews.Author: oooooooooooo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks as a base to travel within PR. Nice accomodations but rooms have NO dressers, none in hotel. Had to request a refridgerator but no micro in hotel! Not an all suites place and the excercise room was moved during our stay but was irrelevent as it was always inop. Hotel pool is shaded most of afternoon but there is an upper sun decking. Ample free parking. Free wifi. Showers only in rooms. Great resturant across street with salsa bar (entertainment) attached. Hotel had upscale rest on top floor and was very good service/food with piano player. Nice atmosphere. We were here to travel to the beaches and visit Old San Juan et el villages. This is in an section previously known as Levittown and a nice community. Supermarket close by and the most busy bakery and sandwich place I have ever encountered in all our travels.. hmmmm good!! Car necessary!! Newer building with great housekeeping!!

Reviews.Title: “terrible service and administration”
Reviews.Author: dicry
Reviews.Content: i make reservation, and the contract say that the check in is after 3pm, but do not say before 12am, so when i get in around 11pm, they already full the hotel with other people just because the activities of san juan, i get not happy but i ask if i have to pay something for the reservation, they say no, then after 3 month they use my credit card to pay the room as a "penalty" (because they has been audited) after i go i get in the hotel in time ans ask if there where penalty for something they got my money without my authorization

Reviews.Title: “Nice view but a lot of traffic noise.”
Reviews.Author: niloc-7
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is almost new, it's not wearing very well. We stayed in a ground floor room at first (no view) and then moved to the 4th floor (ocean view) when the rooms got cheaper. The paint was already blistering and flaking off in both rooms' very small bathrooms, possibly caused by poor ventilation. There's only a small 15 inch square window with louvered glass to ventilate to the outside corridor. This is the first time we had ever seen toilet paper locked in a dispenser, as well as the price list if you decided to take home anything such as the ironing board, bed clothes etc! The furniture was modern and comfortable and the air conditioner effective. The ground floor room was quieter because there's a wall around the pool which cuts down some of the road noise. We could hear a lot of traffic noise through the single plane windows on the 4th floor. The hotel is situated right at a set of traffic lights so there is quite a lot of cars and trucks accelerating away on a green light. The parking lot (holds about 12 cars) always had a LOT FULL sign even when it was almost empty, however there is a larger overflow lot about 50 feet to the south. The breakfast was ok but inconsistent, (one day no waffle mix) TV in breakfast room was always on a New York local channel for some reason! The WiFi was free and fast. Unfortunately there was no business centre to brint our boarding passes for our flight home, There was a special menu in the room for the Porto Bahia 6th floor restaurant which was excellent. We had the Skirt Strip Steak dinner with either a wine or beer for only $9.95 each (not including tax or automatically added gratuity) We had a rental car and on the first day made the mistake of driving into Old San Juan and parking. The traffic is hectic and signs are almost all in Spanish. After that we used the Catana ferry to travel to the old city. The parking was $4 and the fare 50 Cents (25 Cents for Seniors) The terminal is about 12minutes drive from the hotel. The beach across the road from the hotel would be beautiful if it was ever cleaned, there are years of plastic debris strewn all over the sand.

Reviews.Title: “Looks better than the pictures”
Reviews.Author: busybb60
Reviews.Content: First time that I have stayed at this hotel, and I was pleasantly surprised. Hotel is very clean and ultra modern. In the winter, anyway, the sun is only on the pool area for a couple of hours around noon, but there is also a sundeck, where it is sunny longer. the complimentary breakfast was very good = waffles, boiled eggs, bacon. I had a 5th floor room, with balcony overlooking the ocean - a really beautiful view. There is a beach right across the street from the hotel, although it needs a little cleanup. Plenty of sun there. the staf was all very freindly and helpful. Good internet service. Plenty of TV channels and really nice flat panel TV's. I will definitely stay here again, when working in Vega Alta.

Reviews.Title: “Noise & No Parking Spece”
Reviews.Author: Racaldero
Reviews.Content: To much money for the place, you can't sleep after 8:00am and you need to wait until 1:00am to go to the bed, they have a restaurant on the top of the property and is noisy all night and morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel out of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Kanchelskis
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is rather new, it only has one year, and therefore the rooms are nice and very clean. Most of them have balcony looking to the sea, as itÂ´s placed in front of it. Service, breakfast and restaurant (on the 6th floor) are quite good. The Punta Salinas beach is very close, just 5 minutes by car. The hotel is located in the outskirts of San Juan. ThereÂ´s a 20-25 minutes ride by car to Old San Juan, so this Hotel is a great option if you have rented a car.

Reviews.Title: “Further away from the airport than many other accomodations but worth it if you appreciate a clean room.”
Reviews.Author: tonester34
Reviews.Content: Not the most convenient place in terms of location, especially at night after a long flight but the rooms were clean and modern. The place is brand new and has a very modern looking design. The front desk people were very friendly. Small but very nice lobby and breakfast room. You can see the ocean from your room! Two thumbs up on the breakfast. The rooms also have a very contemporary look in terms of the decor and come equiped with flat panel TVs, a very comfortable bed, plenty of pillows, and all of the extras like hair drier, iron, etc. Most importantly, the rooms were very clean - although that is something I would expect from a place so new the paint was barely dry. The restaurant is conveniently located on the top level and was actually pretty good. The accordion player on duty was very friendly and the waitstaff made me feel comfortable. If you are on a budget but want assuarance that you'll get a clean room and a good nights rest,, albeit a bit of a drive, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel....STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: andreasmommie
Reviews.Content: 10/3/2008 - 10/6/2008 This is a 20 minute ride from the airport in San Juan, (taxi is $50). If you want to get away from the tourism this is the place to go. You will see everyday people going to/from work and going out to dinner. But you will still feel like you are on vacation! This is a new hotel less than a year old. Nicely decorated with a modern decor. Clean as a whistle! The rooms are simply nice.... you can't ask for more! To top it all off...you can't beat the price. Continental breakfast was very good. Waffles, muffins, fruit, cereal.....you get the point. The staff was very nice and helpful. They were even patient allowing me to praticar espanol. Across the street is the beach. I would recommend walking down about 1/4 mile to get in the water, but you are not allowed to swim. It is beautiful. Or travel down to the next light and you will be in Punta Salina. The beach there is even better. There are places to eat across the street. Eat at the taco place and at a restaurant around the corner called Restaurante Meson de Playa. GREAT FOOD there! Try the food from the vendors along the road for authentic food. 1. Go to Casa de Bacardi - Tour with two free drinks 2. Go to El Morro in Old San Juan - travel to Catano and take free ferry across. I LOVED this hotel and I LOVED my stay in Puerto Rico!

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Del Valle Ave. 1829 | Levittown, San Juan 00949, Puerto Rico
